parameters: What the hell is Starfleet thinking, aiding the spoonheads.
You're insane to think they're done paying for your losses
during the Dominion War, let alone the Occupation!
Reputation Name = United Federation of Planets
You attempt to de-escalate the situation, but it does not work.
Shut the hell up! You have no right to try and justify helping
them! You didn't live through the damned Occupation and you cannot
stop us Bajorans and Maquis from killing every one of those
Reputation Name = United Federation of Planets
You won't stop all of us! The Prophets will bring our retribution
Pathetic. The Prophets aren't on your side.
The \n[59], a Theta-Class raider formerly under Maquis
Their crew is now in your custody, and the ship is now disabled.
The ship is still relatively intact, Captain. We can choose to
salvage useful components from it and scuttle it, or we could
beam a crew over to recover and add it to our task force.
The data from the ship's main computer has been transferred to
ours. Anything of tactical use will be sent to Starfleet
We're beaming over a crew to salvage it now, \v[17].
Reputation Name = United Federation of Planets
We've beamed a crew over to the \n[59] and the ship
is now fully operational and a part of our task force.
Reputation Name = United Federation of Planets
Understood. We'll let the derelict ship drift back into the
Reputation Name = United Federation of Planets
Scanning the ship will allow you to download information from
their computer cores, granting you Science specialization EXP.
It may also impress Starfleet Command if anything we get proves
Salvaging the ship and scuttling it will prevent it from falling
back into Maquis hands granting you Engineering specialization EXP.
The Cardassians would appreciate it, though the Maquis will not.
Recovering the ship to join your task force will improve your
crew's opinion of you and grant you Command specialization EXP.\!
You could also do nothing, but that would mean that the Maquis
may recover the vessel in the future.
The Sakonna, a Peregrine-Class fighter formerly under Maquis
Their crew is now in your custody, and the ship is now disabled.
Captain, some of the ship's systems are still intact. We could
recover usable materiel from it and scuttle it.

ours. Anything of tactical use will be sent to Starfleet

Federation bastards! You think those stubborn \v[311]ing Cardies

Reputation Name = United Federation of Planets
You attempt to de-escalate the situation, but it does not work.
Nothing the Cardies do now can bring back the people they
slaughtered. Not my friends, not my parents.
They don't deserve any of your goddamn aid. It's a shame you
Reputation Name = United Federation of Planets
\v[310]! But you can't stop all of us! Even your own officers -
veterans of the Dominion War - are on our side. Why can't you see
that we're on the right side of history?
The Dominion War really killed all your good officers, huh?
Starfleet needs to get its \v[313] together.

Greetings, Captain \n[30]. You should probably report to Captain
Greetings, Captain \n[30]. Captain Simpson told us to expect you.
Thank you for coming to help the Cardassians.
What can I, the humble Mumbice, do for you?
What would you like to enquire about?
Ask if he wants to trade
Why of course!\. I am the humble Captain Mumbice of the Cales.
I've been running freight from the Cardassia to the Romulan
Border since the War ended.\! Well, that is, at least when the
Romulan Border still existed, of course.
These days, I'm helping out the Starfleet Merchant Marines with
their humanitarian aid efforts with the Cardassians. It's honest
work, especially compared to runs for that sweet nectar that is
Not that I'd know anything about that, of course.\!
Ah yes, my pride and joy!\. The Cales. I bought it many decades ago
from the Talarians.\. She's home to me now, and I've lived here more
than I ever have portside or planetside.\. The Talarians sold many
freighters like this, especially to the Petarians, but she's mine.
She's old, but she's beautiful, and I'd like to think I've treated
her well over the years. Her engines are rated higher than any
other Antares freighter, and I keep her cargo holds so clean you
She's the only woman I need, and she's mine.\|
Not that I uh,\. particularly need women,\| you know?
Oh, hm.\. Quite,\. uh,\. embarassingly,\| I could do with some help.\!
This old lady of a ship has been due for some upgrades to her main
reactor;\. she's rather inefficient of late, and deuterium
consumption has been getting higher and higher per lightyear.
There's some deuterium gas clouds nearby though, which would prove
most helpful, but she's staying geostationary while unloading.\.
You know how it is with the old lateral-vectors.
But what I'm trying to say is, could you help top her off with
some gas? Three of those standard Starfleet canisters would do.
We'd be most grateful for it.\!
I mean I'd be grateful,\. that is.
Quest Name = Side Quest - She Needs Gas
Oh, thank you very much, \n[30]!\! I can't wait to get her to warp
with a more efficient reactor. I miss her old rumble of the deck
plating.\| Just not the same harmony when it's burning fuel twice
Ask if he wants to trade
Ah yes! I don't have much to offer, but out here away from the
post-scarcity, currency is still exchanged for goods and services!\|
Well you know, there's the whole Federation credits thing. And
interstellar trade needing it and all that.
Very well! Always good to trade with Starfleet.
Thank you oh so much, Captain \n[30]!
This will do nicely for her until I can get the best of the best
of a new warp and fusion reactor.
Quest Name = Side Quest - She Needs Gas
You can find deuterium gas in those gas clouds! Fill up three of
those Starfleet tanks worth of it!
Come now, Captain. She needs more gas than that.
Captain, we should scan the area first.
Captain, we need to disable and apprehend the Maquis first.
All satellites are in place, and they're coming online. We'll need
to run a few basic diagnostics to make sure they're all working,
but that should be it. Well done, \n[30].
Hm. My Chief Engineer is saying that while they appear to be
functioning, long range comms aren't working. Gul, is the colony's
It appears not. Could it be a stellar phenomenon causing this?
Our sensors don't show anything that could be causing this.\.
Wait, scratch that, sensors show large tachyon and chroniton
Peforming mid-range scans of the planet, Captain.
I'll get the computer to corroborate our findings.
Scanning planet and comparing with computer records.
\C[0]As confirmed from Starfleet records, Goralis II is a Class K
Adaptable planet, colonized by the Cardassians.
Information on Goralis II has been added to our library computer.
Captain, a deeper scan of the deuterium gas clouds has revealed
that there are two squadrons of Maquis ships hiding within.
We need to disable their ships and apprehend them before they
can intefere with Starfleet's humanitarian aid project.
Captain, we need to disable the Maquis insurgents.
There's one more Maquis squadron remaining.
We should report to the USS Iliad, Captain.
Scanning the deuterium gas clouds, Captain.\!
I am detecting what appears to be debris from the Maquis ships we
We have the rough coordinates, but our transporters are having some
We'll need to manually target them.
We have recovered some debris! We should move off before doing
We should make some distance before doing another scan.
We need to move further away to conduct another scan.
There is no more debris we can find.
We need to be within the deuterium gas clouds to scan for debris,
We can hail the other ships in orbit to talk to their Captains.
Some may have tasks for us to do, or may be willing to trade.
Otherwise, we can report back to Captain Simpson on the Iliad.
We should contact the Arendal's captain to transport the orbital
We need coordinates to deploy these satellites. We should hail
Goralis II orbital control to get them.
The coordinates for satellite deployment are now available to us.
We should head to them and deploy the satellites.
This is Goralis II orbital control to the \n[29]. We're
transmitting the coordinates for the orbital satellites now. Thank
This is Goralis II Orbital Control. Please proceed with satellite
No response from orbital control, Captain.
We're not in hailing range of orbital control, Captain.
Welcome, Captain \n[30], to the Goralis system.\!
I'm Captain Magnus Simpson, coordinating the aid and relief
efforts on the Federation side of things.\!
Comms, patch in a three-way linkup.
Captain \n[30], meet Gul Karinor, our Cardassian liaison sent by
the Union. She's coordinating the Union's relief efforts and all
Captain. Thank you for joining us. The Union is grateful for your
Without enough ships, this colony has been sadly neglected with a
But, that's what I'm here for, and I have a handle on it.
While we're dealing with other colony matters, \n[30],
you can talk to the other Starfleet and Civilian captains in the
area. Some of them could do with your assistance. It's entirely
optional, and you can report back to me anytime afterward.
Welcome back, Captain. Are you ready to proceed?
What do you need to know?
Captain Magnus Simpson, born on Sengkang, Earth. Two fathers, with
a full genetic mix as well.
Ah! Odyssey-Class, tactical command cruiser. It was meant to be a
bigger and better Sovereign,\. but frankly,\. without the expertise of
Utopia Planitia,\. it ended up and over-designed and complicated
Without the appropriate orbital yards, the Odyssey program was
scrapped in favor of smaller, better, and more specialized ships.
The only Odysseys still around were the thirty or so originally
built, and a few spaceframes they patched up.
The Iliad was one of the original bunch, so here we are. There's
been talk of upgrading the Odysseys, but our class of ship isn't
part of Starfleet's ideology anymore. And maybe that's a good
thing. It's legacy lives on, with three Oddies in museums.
Since the Dominion War, Cardassia has languished with post-war
reparations and lingering neglect.\. We're here to help our allies.
I think most scholars and officers at Fleet Command agree that the
Maquis Resistance were right,\. and how the Federation treated them
But the Maquis Resurgence aren't homesteaders with colonies
they're protecting.\. They're soldiers of fortune, and some are
just former Starfleet officers out for revenge against our
Thank you, Captain. We're fine coordinating from here, but as I
mentioned, some of the individual civilian\. - or even Starfleet and
Cardassian - \.captains could use with your help.
Good timing too, then. I've just gotten a hail from the captain of
the Arendal. They're delivering a set of orbital defense
satellites here, and we'll need your help to deploy them in orbit.
The rest of our ships are busy assisting the Cardassians already,
so you'll need to work with Captain \n[30] to deploy the defense
satellites. \v[4] ship should be more than capable.
The Captain of the Arendal should have more information for you.
Captain, you should hail Orbital Control for further instructions.
The satellite deployment positions should be indicated by your
computer as flashing signals. Head to them and deploy the
Captain \n[30]. You're looking for Captain Simpson, he's on the
Good to meet you, very good indeed. I'm Captain Glott of the USS
Now, what is it you want, Captain?
Captain Bril Glott at your service, born and raised on Bolarus IX.
Went to the SFA campus there, and finished off my final year back
Graduated just a year before the Klingon war. \. It wasn't pretty.
\!I was an engineer on the Armstrong when the Klingons attacked.
And then the Dominion War happened, and I lost my captain at
Chin'toka. Captain Gorax, on the Valley Forge.
Made Captain in a few years after the war ended.\.
Shame my classmates didn't see me get here.
Ah, the Magna Carta! Named for something from Earth History, I
think, to do with Parliaments, as is its class.
Not as good as an Akira, but an engineering platform more than
A step up from an Ambassador, if I do say so myself.
It is as good at engineering, as your Intrepid is at science.
A dedicated engineering vessel for operations here.\!
And a step up from a California, if I do say so myself!
Ah, the good Bolian system. Bolarus IX is truly a beautiful planet,
The fame of the Cliffs of Bole speak for itself.
The system has seen better days, though. The increased tensions in
the sector, the Tulian crisis, the Moropa...\.
All it will take for war is a single spark.\.
And it's been a while,\. since I was home.
My engineering crew can handle what we have to do, but some of the
other crews, especially the civilian ones, would do well with your
Heyo. You should talk to the USS Iliad's Captain.
I'm Ayleen, born and raised on the Xin Zhongguo colony near Alpha
Centauri. Parents were in the Merchant Marines, saw sights from
K'normia to the Sengkang Nebula while growing up on the Sumatra.
Once I was old enough, I wanted to be my own Captain and joined the
Starfleet branch of the Merchant Marines. Now I have the Harukawa
Not much to do these days though, just roaming throughout
Cardassian space as part of aid convoys.
Thanks for the offer, but I'm good here.
I don't have much to spare, just some general Starfleet-grade
Hi! You're looking for the Iliad's captain!
It is what I was given when I signed on to the Starfleet Merchant
Captain, please contact your commanding officer on the Iliad.
Ah, Captain \n[30]. Welcome to Goralis II. Thank you for coming to
What can I do for you?
What do you need to know?
I'm Gul Karinor. I joined the military in the hopes of building a
better home in the wake of the war. I think that's all you need to
The Damar, a Keldon-Class heavy cruiser. Since the war, we've
stripped out most of its weapons, and converted the scanning array
and signals intelligence center into room for cargo and transport.
\!A far cry from what it used to be, but it's what we need now.
What you probably have in your database is just about it, really.
After the war, we set up a mining colony here to help rebuild. The
conditions are harsh for most, but well suited for Cardassians.
Unfortunately, with our own problems back home, the colony was
quickly neglected, and no one really cared as long as we got our
ore. Now, with your help, we're trying to change that.
I don't, but I'm sure some of your ships and the civilian
contractors do. Thank you for helping us, in any case.
Thank you for all the help you can provide.
Thank you for all the help you can provide.
Welcome to Goralis II, Captain. The Starfleet captain in charge of
operations here is on the Iliad.
Is there something I can do for you?
It was tough growing up on post-war Cardassia. After the Dominion -
after the Fire - many of us were orphaned. The capital, Cardassia
City, is where I grew up. It was an orphanage, set up by the
I guess they got the experience from the war orphans after the
It was about, four dozen of us, living in what used to be an old
We were all excited when a Starfleet officer showed up one day.
The Federation had approved the first aid convoy. It was an
engineer, checking out the infrastructure to help us get one of
I didn't comprehend it at the time, of course. it was just cool to
see an alien. And I didn't comprehend how big the Federation's aid
effort was; thousands of ships. I remember being able to see vague
shapes above the clouds in the sky, wondering what they were.
I joined the CSDF. Not to fight, but, to help. Many of our colonies
were neglected during the war, or turned over to Vorta control. And
And I want to protect what we have now.
Ah, the Lang. Small Hideki-Class patrol ship. It's named for
Natima Lang, who was a member of the Cardassian Dissident
Movement. After Dukat sold the Union out just before the war, the
Dissident Movement's refuge on Sadera was destroyed from orbit.
Not personally, but you can try talking to Gul Maket on the
Thanks for all the help you're providing.
You should report in to the USS Iliad.
I don't have anything to say about myself, really.
Old Hideki-Class patrol ship. Now stripped of any of that wartime
Please report in to the Starfleet captain on the USS Iliad first.
I'm just an officer in the CSDF.
You should report in to the Iliad's captain, Starfleet.
Nothing of note, really. Grew up offworld, thankfully. Fast-tracked
post-war into the CSDF. Usual story.
Galor-Class, stripped of most of its firepower with the treaty.
Not that it matters, with a crew as good as mine.
Oh, no, but thank you. We have things handled here.
Thank you for helping the Union in these times. You should report
to your operational commander on the USS Iliad.
Thank you for coming to help us.
What can I do for you, Captain?
I'm Gul Maket. Went up through the ranks from being a Glinn since,
well, just about everyone's gone since the war.
Well, I do have something that needs doing.\.
We've been upgrading our systems under the restriction of the
Do you want to participate in a battle simulation and exercise
with some of the CSDF's ships?
Quest Name = Side Quest - Cardassian Wargames
Well, hail me whenever you're ready, and try not to lose too hard!
Well, if you don't think you can take us on, that's fine.
If this treaty hadn't limited our firepower, we would've won, but
Quest Name = Side Quest - Cardassian Wargames
Well, that wasn't unexpected. Thank you for helping us test our
Quest Name = Side Quest - Cardassian Wargames
Thank you again for helping us, and helping the colony as well.
Quest Name = Side Quest - Cardassian Wargames
I'll be transporting half a dozen of these brand new combination
communications-defense satellites over to your ship. Once you have
them, hail Goralis II Orbital Control. They'll give you the orbital
Hail Orbital Control for more instructions.
Captain \n[30], you need to use your computer interface to hail
Goralis II's Orbital Cotnrol. The command to do so should be
Your computer system should now have visual indicators for the
satellite deployment locations. Get to it, Captain.
Hello, Captain. You should report in to the USS Iliad.
What did you want to ask?
Cardassia born and raised. After the war, I joined the civilian
efforts to help rebuild Lakarian city. And in the years since, I
joined the Merchant Navy to help the outer pre and post-war
I'm doing fine, just maintaining orbit for Orbital and Ground
Control to do regular supply beam-offs.
I don't have any supplies to offer, all of these ar for the colony.
But if you want to sell debris from the Maquis ships you disabled,
I could do with some to melt down for metals later, or scrap for
Come back if you have more junk to sell.
Good. Don't you have more important things to do?
Go report to your commander on the Iliad.
I'm Captain Ronal Bona. I used to be a Gul, you know? Fifth Order.
Fought at the Battle of-, oh, why do you care? I've served my time.
Now I'm just here on a freighter, picking up the pieces that
You have nothing I could need.
Good. Don't you have more important things to do?
Captain \n[30], Captain Simpson is expecting you on the Iliad.
I'm Commander Tara Odhiambo of the USS Dalziel.
Is there something you require, Captain?
Earth born and raised; Kenya, specifically - in the AC.
I joined Starfleet as a noncom, but eventually I decided to go
through the hoops and become an officer, much to my wife's dismay.
It...\. sucks, that after the Borg and the Dominion War, civilian
families aren't allowed on Starfleet vessels, but obviously, it's
for good reason. But I've been doing cargo runs for the Cardies -
It's an older Miranda-Class 6 supply ship. No roll bar or phaser
mega cannons, and more room for cargo and transport.
A slight downgrade from my last posting, though much safer with
Thanks for the offer, but we're almost done here, and don't need
\P[1], you should report to the USS Iliad first.
Captain \n[30], I am Captain Akteek-Ra of the USS Falcata.
How can I help you, Captain?
I'm Captain Akteek-Ra. From the Starfleet Corps of Engineers, hence
the fancy pip. Me and my crew are here to help with some of the
planetside engineering operations. Upgrading systems, getting them
new industrial replicators, repairs, all that sort.
The Falcata is one of a few Saber-Class ships that have been
modified for engineering operations. Unlike some of the more
famous ones like the da Vinci, this was originally built for the
Dominion War and retrofitted just a few years ago.
Thanks for the offer, but our SCE team has everything under
Some of the other ships might need help, though.
Hello. You should report to Captain Simpson on the Iliad first.
Hello, Captain. Welcome to Goralis II. I'm Captain Nil Solara.
You can just call me Solara, though.
What do you want to know?
Well, I don't know what to tell you. I can make a mean hasperat?
I grew up on Bajor, as did my parents, and theirs before them. It
was after the Dominion War, but my grandparents were killed during
I don't think there's any Bajoran who doesn't harbour at least
some ill feelings towards them. I have family members who died
before I was even born; and I wish I got to know them.
But I don't hate the Cardassians. Especially not those I'm helping
today. Hardly any here would've been alive during the Occupation,
and I won't condemn their whole species for it.
I've helped out at several colonies so far. It's-\. it's awkward, of
course. But the Prophets have taught us to help, and after the war,
I think the Cardassians have suffered enough for their past sins.
I don't know what to tell you, it's just a generic freighter.\.
Named "Dohmahr", after one of Bajor's oceans, where the first
wooden ships would've carried freight to the islands away from the
Thank you for offering! I could do with some assistance.
My ship's hull has begun deteriorating - probably a bad deflector
alignment somewhere - but I need some Duranium to patch it up.
Nothing fancy, just enough to keep my hull in one piece until the
next time I hit a dock.
About 50 pieces of \in[103] would do, then I can turn it
